Transcription for 19106

Well, in 1929, I think it was, or 30, this Colory closed down.
So as of now, everybody believed it. They were depending upon this place, this area.
To the old, old, Bumbley's Court pit.
Once that closed well, that was the end of it.
There was nothing now but starvation.
And that was a terrible day, unemployment.
Well, we were all on the side, we couldn't...
You know, that had got so much into our blood, well, there we were.
I mean, what on earth could they do?
